original_title: Sri Lanka rupee closes stronger at 329.50/50 to the US dollar
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka rupee closed at 329.40/50 in the spot market, stronger from yesterday, dealers said while bond yields closed lower.
The rupee closed at 330/331 to the US dollar in the spot market Wednesday.
A bond maturing on 15.05.2030 closed at 14.20/35 percent down from Wednesday’s close at 14.42/48 percent.
A bond maturing on 01.05.2028 closed at 14.35/50 percent down from yesterday’s 14.75/82 percent
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 closed at 15.95/16.05 percent down from yesterday’s 15.20/35 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.05.2026 closed at 15.20/30 percent steady from yesterday’s 15.40/45 percent.
A bond maturing on 01.07.2025 closed at 15.60/90 percent steady from yesterday’s 15.80/16.00 percent. (Colombo/July28/2023)
